brewery.brewery_description: Hardknott no longer brews beer. Sorry to all those people who are sad about this - it was a blast while it lasted, but we have now moved onto other things. We are now involved with electronics. We would like to develop this further, but are yet to see exactly how it'll work.... We were located in West Cumbria - one the of the most beautiful parts of the world. Our birthplace was at the foot of the notorious Hardknott Pass, from which we take our name. We then relocated to the foot of Black Combe, which dominates the skyline of the Duddon Estuary. We took our influences from world beers like Belgian Monastery beers and American Craft Beers.

venue.venue_name: Zona Artigianale - Pizza, Burgers & Craft Beers

beer.beer_description:
Packed full of Cascade, Centennial, Galaxy and Willamette hops from the west coast of America married with good old British malted barley and of course pure Cumbrian water drawn from the Lake District fells.

Our robust regular contemporary best bitter. Citrus and dark berries on the nose with lots of lemon and blackcurrant flavours with a large and long lasting bitter finish. Great with strong flavoured Northern classics like Shepherd’s pie or Cumberland Sausage and whole grain mustard.

items.badge_description: Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 60 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 13.

items.checkin_comment: Jul '15. Bottle, 330ml from Tebay Services, Orton, Cumbria.

items.badge_description: The kölsch style has a rich heritage, originating in Cologne, Germany. It's clear, crisp, medium hopped flavors are always refreshing. Try 5 more for Level 9!

items.checkin_comment: Jul '15. Bottled, 330ml from Tebay Services, Orton, Cumbria.

beer.beer_description: Dark, fruity, bitter, spicy.Galena and Willamette hops and a grist mix as complicated as an astrophysicist’s equation.

items.badge_description: Originally created and brewed for Russian Emperor Peter the Great, the Russian Imperial Stout has a history as rich as it’s roasty, hoppy flavor. That's 45 different beers with the style of Russian Imperial Stout! Try 5 more for Level 10!

items.checkin_comment: Aug '15. Bottled, 330ml from Tebay Services, Orton, Cumbria.
Feb '16. Cask conditioned at Fleetwood Beer Festival ’16.

beer.beer_description:
We know that your reactions occur without extraneous influences, but just sometimes your visit to the pub could do with that extra stimulus to enable maximum performance.

Of course, your possession of this extra special formulation will not remain part of your long-term chemical make-up and we cannot encourage you to consider any permanent enhancements as a result.

Katalyst, a pale refreshing juicy asparagus nose with a summer salad crispness to the middle. Celery and nuts give way to refreshing bite at the end. Perfect with salads. Available as standard in firkins.

items.checkin_comment: May '16. Bottled 330ml from Booths Supermarket, Kendal, Cumbria.

beer.beer_description:
Queboid is not square. It contains solid geometry encased in its hex-faceted flavour profile and coordinated with its parallelpiped direction makes for a right angled and perpendicular drinking experience. Pale malts face off against a balance of darker grain. Citrus hops tangent with juicy berry notes and a vertex of spiritual alcohol is redirected by the Belgian fruity yeast node.

Or in English, a beer that has influences from three continents: Asia, through the now well known and often miss-quoted legend of the trade between Britain and India, West Coast American hop varieties and the influence of the striking yeast varieties of Belgian Abbey beers.

A strong citrus nose with spicy fruity banana & full on golden syrup flavour to finish.

items.checkin_comment: Dec '16. Ket at Cherry Reds, Birmingham.

beer.beer_description:
Figgy Pudding is our first ever Christmas beer. We might do it every year, but as yet is the first year we’ve made it. It’s got figs in it. Doh, who’d a thunked it?

It’s also got some cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger in too, in a kinda dry spiced way,. after fermentation. Anyhow, not unsurprisingly, it tastes a little bit like Christmas. Does what it says on the tin.

items.badge_description: It's cold outside - warm up with Winter beers. That's at least 210 different Winter beers try 5 more for Level 43!

items.checkin_comment: Jan '17. Bottled, 330ml from Morrisons in Banbury, Oxon
Jan '17. Bottled, 330ml from Morrisons in Banbury, Oxon.

beer.beer_description:
Buy Nuclear Sunset and put your global conscience at ease.
This beer is a crisp international wheat beer. Made with orange peel, orange juice, coriander and nutmeg. It should be cloudy and there will be a sediment in the bottle if it is left to settle. We like it served with the sediment swilled out into the glass.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 460 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 93!

beer.beer_description:
Azimuth is a directional IPA. It guides you further through your beer journey keeping your bearings straight and true to the cause. Don’t drink too much, lest you become a horizontal bearing.

A zesty orange pith nose with flavours of peach and apricot skins, a hint of caramel honeysuckle and spring gorse flowers.
